properties.name: Beach Blvd Flea & Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta    11041 Beach Boulevard, Jacksonville, FL, 32246Every Saturday morning we go here to buy special produce for my wife\'s Filipino cooking. They have everything from Pechay to Sitaw, as well as green mangoes and Kang Kong. There are three major specialty produce vendors, but the best one is the one owned by a family from Cambodia. Their prices are VERY inexpensive and the selection is outstanding!

properties.name: Casa Bonita
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   6715 W Colfax Ave Denver CO 80214If you\'ve ever seen South Park, you may remember the episode where Cartman gets grounded and can\'t go to Casa Bonita, the \'Fun Mexican Restaurant\' in Denver. It\'s like a Mexican food-meets-Disney concept, with waterfalls , caves, playgrounds, and cliff-divers. Every kid in Colorado dreams of dining at least once here. I was no exception! Located in the Cinderella City mall on West Colfax.

properties.name: Challenger Middle School
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta  10215 Lexington Drive Colorado Springs, CO 80920This is where I spent my tweens

properties.name: Chicken Annie's
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta Rr 1, Pittsburg, KS 66762The BEST fried chicken and cole slaw ever! My grandparents used to order this stuff by the bucket and we\'d devour it all in one sitting! The cole slaw is the German type, with the vinegar and pepper, not the creamy kind.

properties.name: Conway's Red Top
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 5865 Palmer Park Blvd Colorado Springs CO 80915If you\'re ever in Colorado Springs and are hungry for hamburgers, Conway\'s Red Top is a MUST! Burgers here are the size of the plate on which they\'re served, so come hungry!

properties.name: Denver Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   2001 Colorado Blvd., Denver, Colorado 80205 I used to LOVE going here as a kid on school field trips! There is so much to see here! One thing I will always remember is going to the IMAX theatre at the DMNS. I\'d never seen movies that big before!

properties.name: Eugene Field Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 1009 E 6th St, Pittsburg, KS 66762The school where I attended kindergarten through 2nd grade

properties.name: Fresh Market
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 10968 San Jose Blvd, Jacksonville, FL 32223This is a gourmet grocery store, just south of I-295 on Claire Lane and San Jose. They specialize in gourmet foods, my favorite being the Bourbon Salmon. They sell fresh meats and vegetables, in addition to other gourmet items such as cheese, wine, beer, coffee, candy, etc. If you do get the Bourbon Salmon there, make sure you get it pre-cooked. You can buy it uncooked and bake it at home, but it\'s much better pre-cooked.

properties.name: George Nettels Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 2012 S Homer St, Pittsburg, KS 66762The elementary school where I spent my 3rd thru 5th grade years.

properties.name: High Plains Elementary
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 2248 Vintage Drive Colorado Springs, CO 80920This is where I spent my first year in Colorado

properties.name: Huguenot Park
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta  One of the cleanest beaches in the Jacksonville area.

properties.name: Independent Records
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   3031 E Platte Ave Colorado Springs, CO 80909Independent Records is Colorado Springs\' top stop for rare and hard-to-find music, in addition to mainstream music. If you\'re look ing for something, chances you will find it here. If not, they\'ll get it for you. I used to buy all of my concert tickets here, as well as shop for CD\'s and shirts.

properties.name: Jax Oriental Market
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta  10584 Saint Augustine Rd Ste 2 Jacksonville, FL 32257This is a GREAT place for all things oriental! My wife is from the Phippines and is always looking for special ingredients for her Filipino dishes. Their prices are very reasonable and the selection is great!

properties.name: Koji's Japan
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles CA 90028If you\'re in the mood for unique Japanese dining, give this spot a go. It\'s a Japanese restaurant that specializes in \'Shabu-Shabu\'. Shabu-Shabu is basically like Chinese Hot Pot, or a \'water fondue\'. You order a plate of meat and vegetables, and cook them yourself in a boiling bowl of water. When you\'re done, you can eat the soup you\'ve made by cooking. Everytime I\'m in L.A., I make sure to stop here! There are two locations, one in the Hollywood/Highland Shopping Center, and the other is in The Block at Anaheim.

properties.name: Manila Good-Ha!
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 231 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles CA 90004Los Angeles is a place where you can find any type of authentic cuisine. One night, while in L.A., my wife started craving some Dinuguan. When I queried the GPS, this place, Manila Good-Ha! Came up. And, it was close to where we were, so we trekked our way to it. Boy was she happy! Not only did they have Dinuguan, they had had everything else! Needless to say, next time we go to L.A., we\'ll be visiting Manila Good-Ha! again!

properties.name: Metro Diner
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 3302 Hendricks Ave, Jacksonville, 32207One of the oldest diners in Jacksonville, The Metro Diner has been serving up great food since 1938. My favorite is their breakfast, but I would gladly go there for lunch if the occasion arose!

properties.name: Michelle's Chocolatiers
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   122 N Tejon Street Colorado Springs, CO 80903A must-see if you visit Colorado Springs! This has been around since 1952 and still exists in its original location. Be sure to check out the Pikes Peak Surprise! Believe me, you\'ll see what I mean!

properties.name: Moe's Broadway Bagel
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 2650 Broadway Boulder, CO 80304I love bagels, and when I was in college, I always got my bagels from Moe\'s.

properties.name: Museum of Science and History
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   1025 Museum Cir, Jacksonville, FL 32207This is a nice weekend diversion. For about the smae price of a movie, you can take the kids to the museum to learn about Dinosaurs, Humpback whales, and see a Planetarium show. Not as much to see as the Smithsonian, but interesting nonetheless.

properties.name: Panera Bread
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 1615 Hendricks Avenue jacksonville FL 32207Panera Bread...the BEST bakery I know of! Every visit here yields a wealth of delicious delights. My favorite is the Ham and White Cheese Scone. To drink, the Honey Ginseng Green Tea gets my day started right! Stop by and pick up a dozen bagels, or, stay for a while and have breakfast, lunch or dinner! For whatever reason you go, you\'re sure to leave happy!

properties.name: Potter's Bar & Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta   1207 Pearl St Boulder CO 80302THE place for all CU Students to hang out Thursday through Saturday. It\'s been about 10 years but when I was there, you could get in for free. Located on the Pearl Street Mall.

properties.name: Rampart High School
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta  8250 Lexington Drive Colorado Springs, CO 80920This is where I went to high school.

properties.name: Seafood City Supermarket
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta  131 W Carson St Carson CA 90745This place is AWESOME! If you\'re a Filipino, and you\'re looking for everything from home that you miss, this is the place! There\'s a Jollibee, a Red Ribbon Bakery, and a Chow King. The centerpiece is a HUGE Filipino market that has just about everything you could ever need. Whenever my wife and I visit the Los Angeles area, we make sure to stop here!

properties.name: University of Colorado
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta1202 University Avenue, Boulder, CO, 80302This is my alma mater. I spent 4 years in college here.

properties.name: University of Colorado at Colorado Springs
properties.description: Posted by Pettusta 1420 Austin Bluffs Pkwy, Colorado Springs, CO 80918This is where I spent my first college years. It\'s grown a lot since the early 90\'s
